content.description: Hard to keep it in the grade unless you climb around some. If you try climbing shortest distance between two bolts you will find it a good deal harder.  There is a good clipping hold up by the bolt with the run out just keep working the feet until you find it.
content.location: Closer to the left edge of the Knight than the Bishop.  Left facing flake crack system that ends at the top of a short left facing dihedral.

content.description: From the ledge scramble up easy terrain to clip a high first bolt.  Now that you are safe, wrestle edges and crimps until reaching a roof.  Avoid the temptation to bypass the roof -- engage it head on.  Veer up and right on easier terrain, taking note of rock quality, and pull up to the hidden anchors.
content.protection: Bolts and chains.  The chain anchors are a bit recessed so I would recommend shoulder length slings for working the route and rappelling at the end.
content.location: "Knight To Pawn Four" is located on Knight Wall.  It is to the right of "Knight Maneuvers" and the left of "Checkmate".  The route can be identified by the high first bolt.

content.description: Nice moves that are a little tricky to read lead to a pumpy section past a roof. Rock looks funky up high but it is good.  Down low you want to look before you pull but the climbing is pretty easy.
content.location: Chessman on the Knight.  Starts right of an obvious left facing crack/flake system that has bolts.

climbs.name: Knight Maneuvers
climbs.fa: Eric Fazio-Rhicard, Jim Scott, Erica Bigio (2008)

content.description: Clip two shared bolts with "Knight Owl" and fork right to harder climbing.  Pull delicate ledges and meander around a blank face.  Recharge at a no-hands rest and before gunning for the top.  The rock is a little grungy after the roof.
content.protection: Bolts and chains.  Leaver biners at the top to speed cleaning.
content.location: Knight Maneuvers is located on Knight Wall.  To the left is "Knight Owl" and to the right is "Knight To Pawn Four".

content.description: Tricky crux section with sustained climbing for a bit after then a cool roof move.
content.protection: Bolts, Anchors that are in a bad but still usable location.
content.location: Second to last route on the right side of the  Knight.  Starts right of a crack/flake system that ends with a bolt about 15 feet off of the ground This is a route called Knight to Pawn Four.  This climb starts at a shallow right facing corner.

content.description: Two fun bulges with easy but interesting slab climbing between.
content.location: Right hand side of the Knight just before you go around the corner.  Starts on a ledge that makes you hope your partner gets the first bolt clipped before falling off.

content.description:
The six front-facing, sport lines range in difficulty from 5.10 to 5.11.  Knight Owl and Knight Maneuvers are considered the best.  The four traditional and mixed lines on the south face are 5.6 to 5.9+ and all are R rated. 

  The front face is shaded until approximately 2pm.  The south face receives sun most of the day.
